exercise_name: Seated Straight Leg Swing Over Object

source.query: seated leg swings over hurdle muscles worked
source.raw_text:
The Seated Straight Leg Swing Over Object primarily works the hip flexors, quadriceps, and core muscles. The movement pattern involved is a combination of hip flexion, abduction, and adduction while maintaining knee extension and core stability. [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]  
Muscles Worked 

• Primary Movers: 

    • Hip Flexors: These are the main muscles responsible for lifting the leg and moving it over the object. Key muscles include the iliopsoas (iliacus and psoas major) and rectus femoris. 
    • Quadriceps: All four quadriceps muscles (rectus femoris, vastus lateralis, vastus medialis, and vastus intermedius) engage isometrically to keep the leg straight throughout the entire movement. 
    • Core Muscles: The abdominal muscles (especially the lower abs) and lower back muscles work to stabilize the pelvis and torso, particularly when minimizing the use of hands for support. 

• Secondary/Stabilizer Muscles: 

    • Hip Adductors: These inner thigh muscles help control the leg's movement toward the midline of the body (adduction) as it swings over and down the other side of the object. 
    • Hip Abductors: These muscles (like the gluteus medius) are involved in moving the leg away from the body's midline (abduction) and stabilizing the pelvis. 
    • Glutes: The gluteus maximus is engaged to assist with hip stability. 
    • Sartorius and Tensor Fasciae Latae (TFL): These also assist in the hip movement. [1, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10, 11]  

Movement Patterns 
The exercise incorporates several fundamental movement patterns related to lower body and core control: 

• Hip Flexion/Extension: The primary action involves lifting and lowering the leg, which is a key function of the hip flexors. 
• Hip Abduction/Adduction: As the leg is raised and moved over the object, it performs abduction (moving away from the midline) and then adduction (moving back toward the midline). 
• Core Stabilization: Maintaining an upright or slightly leaned-back posture requires significant core engagement, which is a crucial aspect of this exercise. 
• Knee Extension (Isometric): The quadriceps remain contracted throughout the movement to maintain a straight leg. [7, 8, 14, 15, 16]  

The "Seated Straight Leg Swing Over Object" is an effective low-impact exercise for enhancing hip strength, mobility, and core stability, often used in physical therapy and as a preparatory exercise for more advanced movements like the L-sit. [7, 17]
